business.headline: JSW Energy shares price rises 6% today. Here's why JSW Energy share price: The stock has lost 20.14% in the last month and 23.69% over the past six months. Despite the recent decline, JSW Energy has gained 16.15% over the past year.

JSW Energy share price jumps nearly 7%. Why is it gaining today?JSW energy share price: The stock opened at Rs 528.15, and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 552.50 at around 11:07 am, marking a jump of 6.59% jump.

Explained: Why HCLTech share price fell nearly 10% despite positive Q3 resultsHCLTech share price: At 10:46 am, HCLTech's shares were trading 9.02% lower at Rs 1,806.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, its shares hit an intraday low of Rs 1,798.40.

Sensex, Nifty rebound: What's driving today's gains, and will the recovery last?Despite today's rally, the stock market remains under pressure due to several factors, especially the impact of Q3 earnings and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors.

Quadrant Future Tek listing: Shares make strong D-Street debut at 27% premium Quadrant Future Tek stock: The stock opened at Rs 370 on the NSE, reflecting a 27.5% premium over its IPO price of Rs 290.
Stock market rebound: Sensex, Nifty gain in early trade; HCLTech down 9% The S&P BSE Sensex gained 408.52 points to 76,738.53, while the NSE Nifty50 110.05 points to 23,196.00 as of 9:30 AM.

TikTok US may go to Elon Musk as China explores potential sale: ReportChinese authorities want to keep TikTok under the control of its parent company, ByteDance. One potential scenario involves Elon Musk's social media platform, X, acquiring TikTok US and running it jointly with ByteDance.

Stock market holiday: Are BSE, NSE open on January 14, Makar Sankranti?The holiday schedules for the BSE and NSE are determined based on national holidays and key religious and cultural festivals that are widely observed across the country.
Red alert on Dalal Street: Should investors worry?Sensex, Nifty today: While the sharp decline may cause concern, historical data suggests that market corrections are not uncommon.
Stocks to watch today: JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, BEL, Adani WilmarStocks such as JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, Delta Corp, United Spirits, and BEL are expected to remain in focus.
Retail inflation eases to 4-month low of 5.22% in DecemberIndia's inflation eased to 5.22% in December 2024 as food prices slowed, with the RBI maintaining a cautious policy stance.
Budget 2025: 5 important things government needs to addressGoldman Sachs outlines five key questions on fiscal deficit, spending, and growth ahead of Budget 2025.

Market crash wipes out Rs 13 lakh crore. Will D-Street's losing streak continue? Stock Market Crash: Dalal Street faced another sharp decline on Monday, with key indices tumbling and investors suffering heavy losses. Is this a temporary dip, or the start of a prolonged bear run?

Activate your UAN for EPFO's ELI scheme benefits before January 15. Here's howThe deadline for UAN activation has been extended to January 15, 2025, urging employees to complete the process to avail ELI scheme benefits.
Monday mayhem on Dalal Street as Sensex tanks 1,100 pointsThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1048.90 points to end at 76,330.01, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.55 points to close the day at 23,085.95.
NPCI issues clarification on 'Jumped Deposit Scam.' 3 key things to knowNPCI debunks 'Jumped Deposit Scam' fears, urging UPI users to stay alert and trust in the platform's robust security.

Sensex nosedives over 1,100 points. Why did stock market crash today?Stock market crash: The Sensex was down 1041.18 points to 76,337.73 at 2:50 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 329.70 points lower at 23,101.80. All the other broader market indices were trading in negative territory as volatility skyrocketed during the afternoon trading session.

Want to get your credit card's annual fee waived? Follow these stepsMany banks offer ways to waive credit card annual fees by meeting specific spending thresholds, allowing you to enjoy benefits without extra costs.

Trading platform Groww plans IPO at $6-8 billion valuation: ReportIf successful, Groww's listing will mark the first IPO by a digital trading platform in India, adding a new chapter to the rapidly expanding fintech landscape.

Laxmi Dental IPO: Should you bid for the Rs 698.06 crore public listing? Laxmi Dental IPO will remain open for subscription until January 15, 2024 with allotment for shares expected to be completed on January 16, 2025.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Freebies to continue, 'Kejriwal's Guarantee' to have 8–10 promises: SourcesThe AAP's manifesto will be called 'Kejriwal's Guarantee', on the lines of the 'Modi ki Guarantee' slogan that was launched by the BJP ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha election.

No WAGs, family on tour: BCCI disciplines India after Australia seriesThe Indian Cricket Board has reacted sharply to India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Sources have told India Today that the BCCI has cracked the whip on the Indian team and has taken strict steps to get their focus back on the game.

Millions gather for first Amrit Snan at Maha Kumbh on Makar SankrantiThe amrit snan will witness the participation of 13 Akharas, or monastic orders of Hinduism, who will adhere to a meticulously planned schedule for the ritual bath.

'The Sandman' author Neil Gaiman raped babysitter in front of his son: ReportA bombshell report details further sexual assault allegations by eight women against author Neil Gaiman, including claims of rape and abuse by a former babysitter.

Isro gets new chief as S Somnath leaves after conquering Sun and MoonOn Tuesday, Dr. S. Somanath will step down as chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro), leaving behind a legacy of unparalleled achievements.

How this Malibu mansion defeated wildfire. It's a concrete miracleAmid the devastation in Malibu from the California wildfires, a USD 9-million mansion stands unscathed and defiant. Its owner, a retired waste-management executive, called it a "miracle". However, the three-storey house's survival is more of science than miracle.
Ex-girlfriend arrested in abetting Noida law student's suicideFollowing a complaint lodged by Tapas's father, Noida Police registered a case of abetment to suicide against the ex-girlfriend.

Oscar 2025 nominations announcement postponed again amid Los Angeles wildfiresThe Oscars nominations have faced a second delay as wildfires rage in Los Angeles, disrupting Hollywood's awards season. The Academy has rescheduled events to support the affected community.

From Thar Roxx to Windsor, Swift and more: How did new models of 2024 perform?Several new cars entered the market in 2024. Among them, the Thar Roxx, Windsor EV, Curvv and the fourth-generation Swift performed very well in terms of sales. We expect them to do better this year.

Watch: Kapil Dev responds to Yograj Singh's shocking 'pistol' claimFormer India captain Kapil Dev has reacted to Yograj Singh's claims that he went to the former skipper's house to kill him. Yograj had said that he wanted to shoot Kapil after being dropped from the North Zone team.

Ram Kapoor praises 'self-made' Rakhi Sawant, says industry tried to 'misuse' herRam Kapoor lauds Rakhi Sawant as a self-made star, crediting her hard work for her success despite industry challenges. He also opened up about her struggles during Rakhi Ka Swayamwar.

Goa Chief Minister stresses mental health, cites Sushant Singh Rajput's suicideSushant Singh Rajput, a celebrated Bollywood actor, died by suicide on June 14, 2020 in his Mumbai home. The Mumbai Police launched an investigation into the death, which became a subject of widespread speculation and rumours.

Delhi CA slammed for denying maid Rs 1,000 raise, calls it a 'corporate lesson'In a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Delhi-based CA admitted she refused to increase her maid's salary by Rs 1,000 and turned the incident into a series of so-called "corporate lessons".

Comet that won't return for 1,60,000 years is on its way to the SunThe comet, which orbits the Sun every 1,60,000 years, was first discovered on April 5, 2024, by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) in Chile.

How Ozempic, Zepbound, and Mounjaro will transform India's weight loss marketThe proportion of obese Indians has risen from 25 per cent in 2013 to 40 per cent in 2023, highlighting the need for effective weight-loss drugs.

Champion last year, Rohan Bopanna suffers shock first-round exitAustralian Open 2025: The Indo-Colombian pair of Rohan Bopanna and Nicolas Barrientos was knocked out in the opening round of men's doubles on Tuesday, January 14. Bopanna, who won the Australian Open last year with Matthew Ebden, hasn't had a great start to the new season with his new partner.

Watch: Trump spoofs viral chat with Barack Obama, roasts Kamala Harris, BidenIn the parody video, Barack Obama appears to admit Kamala Harris had little chance of winning against Donald Trump. "I knew you'd win," the former president tells the President-elect in the fake audio.

Kapil Dev urges people to not compare Jasprit Bumrah with himFormer India all rounder Kapil Dev has asked people to not draw comparisons between him and India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah. Bumrah recently broke Kapil's record of most wickets by an Indian in Australia.

Past glory keeps my hunger going for more in the future: PV SindhuP.V. Sindhu remains steadfast in her pursuit of badminton glory, drawing inspiration from past triumphs and evolving her game to stay competitive while mentoring India's next generation of players. Her passion and resilience continue to fuel her journey.

Shreyas Iyer ready to bat anywhere in ICC Champions Trophy 2025Star India batter Shreyas Iyer said that he's ready to bat anywhere in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. The mega event is all set to begin from February 19.

Who is Nishesh Basavareddy? Indian-origin teen makes stunning Grand Slam debutNishesh Basavareddy left the tennis world in awe with a gutsy performance against Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open. The 19-year-old American of Indian origin embraced his Grand Slam debut with poise, earning respect from his idol.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
